definition: to express gratitude (esp. in public)/vote of thanks/also written 鳴謝|鸣谢
to engrave/inscribed motto
to thank/to apologize/to wither (of flowers, leaves etc)/to decline
surname Xie
many thanks/thanks a lot
can't thank sb enough (idiom)
to be indebted (to sb)
lit. will not be forgotten even after one's teeth fall out/to remember as long as one lives/unforgettable (idiom)
hard to forget even after one's teeth fall out (idiom); to remember a benefactor as long as one lives/undying gratitude
to speak seriously/to exaggerate
profound love, generous friendship (idiom)
undue trouble/Thank you for having gone out of your way to help me.
(polite) thank you for your trouble (used when asking a favor or after having received one)
to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/vexation/inconvenience
your favor amounts to being given a new lease on life (idiom)
unable to return the favor
benefactor
lit. I dare not (accept the honor); fig. I don't deserve your praise/you flatter me
to come with a specific purpose in mind
profound love
